page.title: 03PAST AND PRESENT HIGH DOWN
page.content: We asked about'ghosts'!The presence of a young woman is occasionally felt in an upstairs room.She supposedly witnessed the death of her beloved,a Cavalier,when he was killed by Roundheads in the courtyard.It is this demented girl who can be'felt'in the bedroom.The only modernisation seemed to be central heating and a swimming pool.The Lady of the house, plus a daily help,keep the house in order.We saw the fine gardens,and the interesting architectural features i.e Tudor archways,coats_of_arms,and very old stables.Pheasant rearing is a family interest with eight'shoots' a year.Apart from pheasants they rear the Redlegged Partridge,endangered by insecticides in the surrounding fields.There are 320 acres of land,a combination of woods,crops and cattle. A lovely afternoon of living history.
